tradition.title: 900 Years of Tradition. A Night You'll Never Forget.
tradition.description: Since 1104, every year on August 4th, Termoli comes to a halt. The bells ring at dawn, the sea fills with boats, and thousands of people pour into the streets to celebrate San Basso, the patron saint of fishermen and sailors. It's not just a religious holiday. It's a time when an entire community comes together, celebrates its roots, and creates memories that last a lifetime.
tradition.titlepic1: The procession that will give you shivers
tradition.descriptionpic1: At 6 a.m., when the sky is still pink, the statue of San Basso is loaded onto a fishing boat and taken out to sea. Dozens of boats follow it in procession, while thousands of people watch in silence from the shore. When the Saint blesses the waters, all that can be heard is the sound of the waves and the bells. It's a moment of pure emotion that sinks into you and never leaves. Even non-believers are enchanted by this ancient dance between faith, sea, and community.
tradition.titlepic2: Where the sacred meets the craziest celebration of the summer
tradition.descriptionpic2: After the procession, Termoli explodes. The old town becomes a labyrinth of lights, music, and the aroma of fried fish. The alleys fill with people dancing until dawn, the bars stay open all night, and fireworks light up the sky for twenty minutes over the harbor. The fish festival continues for three days, with stands serving the best Adriatic specialties. And on the night of the 5th, traditional bonfires are lit on the beach: groups of friends and families sing, dance, and celebrate until dawn, with their feet in the sand and their hearts full of joy.

program.title: 72 hours that will change your summer
program.description: Three days, hundreds of events, thousands of people. Processions at dawn, concerts until dawn, fish festivals, fireworks by the sea, DJ sets, bonfires on the beach. Termoli doesn't sleep for three nights. And you won't want to miss a single second of it.
program.titlepic1: From the sacred to the profane in the blink of an eye
program.descriptionpic1: August 3rd begins with the procession to the sea at dawn: a moment of silence and spirituality that will leave you breathless. Then the city wakes up, and the real party begins. Concerts in Piazza Duomo with local artists and tribute bands, the fish festival that fills the streets with irresistible aromas, the amusement park on the seafront for families. And at 11:30 pm, the most beautiful fireworks display on the Adriatic: twenty minutes of fireworks that start from the sea and illuminate the entire town. After midnight, the DJs take over and the music doesn't stop until dawn.
program.titlepic2: Bonfires, the beach, and the last magical night
program.descriptionpic2: August 5th is the most special day. During the day, there are beach volleyball tournaments, the village craft market, and the energy is still high. But the magic explodes in the evening: at 10:30 pm, dozens of bonfires are lit along the coast. It's an ancient tradition, jumping over the flames for good luck. Guitars emerge from backpacks, people sing folk songs, they dance on the sand, and dive into the sea at night. And at dawn on August 6th, when the last bonfire goes out and the sun rises over the Adriatic, we bid farewell to San Basso with a final collective swim. It's the perfect way to end three days you'll never forget.

tradition.title: A Centuries-Old Tradition
tradition.description1: The San Basso festival is the beating heart of Termoli, a celebration rooted in the 13th century that still unites the entire community today.
tradition.description2: Every year, on August 3rd, 4th and 5th, the city transforms into a riot of colors, music and tradition. The Patron Saint is carried in procession through the streets of the old town to the sea, in a moment of deep spirituality and popular celebration.

page.title: The Story of San Basso
page.subtitle: Centuries of tradition, faith and community

origins.title: The Origins
origins.content: Devotion to Saint Basso the Bishop has ancient roots. According to tradition, his relics arrived in Termoli in the year 1104, brought by crusaders returning from the Holy Land. From that moment, San Basso became the patron saint of the city and guardian of fishermen.

legend.title: The Legend
legend.content: It is said that during a terrible storm that threatened to destroy the fishermen's boats, a luminous figure appeared and calmed the waters. The fishermen recognized San Basso in that figure, who from that day became their protector. Since then, every year, the Saint is carried in procession to the sea to bless the waters and protect those who sail them.

procession.title: The Procession
procession.content: The culminating moment of the festival is the procession on August 4th. The statue of San Basso is carried on the shoulders of the faithful through the narrow streets of the old town, accompanied by the marching band and followed by thousands of people. The procession winds its way to the port, where the blessing of the sea is given, a moment of great emotion and spirituality.

today.title: The Festival Today
today.content: Today the San Basso festival is one of the most important events in Molise. It combines the religious dimension with the popular one: alongside sacred rites, concerts, shows, markets and tastings take place. It is a moment when the entire community comes together, celebrating its roots and looking to the future with hope.

community.title: A United Community
community.content: The preparation of the festival involves hundreds of volunteers: from decorating the streets, to organizing events, to logistics management. It is months of work that testifies to the strength of community bonds and the pride in keeping alive a tradition that spans the centuries.

program.title: Program
program.subtitle: Three days of celebration, tradition and fun in the heart of Termoli

events.title: Sea Procession - San Basso
events.description: The day begins at dawn with the solemn sea procession. The statue of San Basso is loaded onto the fishing boat drawn by lot the previous evening and taken out to sea for the traditional blessing of the waters. A procession of boats accompanies the Patron Saint on a scenic route along the Termoli coast, while the Cathedral bells ring in celebration. The return to the port is welcomed by the band and the faithful waiting on the dock.

events.title: Solemn Holy Mass
events.description: Liturgical celebration in the Cathedral presided over by the Bishop. During the service, bread and fish are blessed, symbols of Termoli's maritime tradition.

events.title: Traditional Lunch
events.description: In the old town, tables are set up for the community lunch. Termoli-style fish stew, pasta with clams and other seafood specialties prepared according to recipes handed down through generations.

events.title: Amusement Park Opening
events.description: The amusement park opens on the waterfront. Rides for all ages, cotton candy, roasted chestnuts and traditional illuminated stalls transform the waterfront into a village of lights and colors.

events.title: Fish Festival - Street Food
events.description: Food stands along the entire main street. Fried fish, panzerotti, Molise-style arrosticini, Termoli scapece and ventricina. Adriatic culinary tradition meets the flavors of the Molise hinterland. Open bars with live music and roaming DJ sets.

events.title: Live Concert - Cathedral Square
events.description: Local artists and emerging bands on the main stage. Tributes to great Italian and international bands animate the old town until late at night.

events.title: Grand Fireworks Display
events.description: From the sea, a spectacular choreography of fireworks lights up the sky and reflects on the harbor waters. Twenty minutes of pure emotion with light and color displays accompanied by a soundtrack. The most anticipated moment of the festival.

events.title: DJ Set & After Party
events.description: The night continues with the best DJs from the Adriatic scene. Electronic music, house and techno until dawn on the waterfront.

events.title: Craft Market
events.description: The traditional market is held in the old town with ceramics, local handicrafts, typical products and artisan creations. Perfect opportunity to take home a piece of Termoli.

events.title: Beach Sports Tournaments
events.description: Beach volleyball, beach soccer and impromptu tournaments on the sand. Swimming races and diving from the pier for the bravest. Awards at sunset with gadgets and local products.

events.title: Bonfire Preparation - Beach
events.description: Traditional bonfires are set up along the coast. Groups of friends and families gather on the sand with guitars, food and drinks to celebrate the last night of the San Basso festival.

events.title: Traditional Bonfire Lighting
events.description: At dusk, dozens of bonfires are lit simultaneously all along the coast. Ancient tradition says you should jump over the flames for good luck. Live acoustic music, folk dances and traditional songs accompany the night.

events.title: Night of Bonfires - Until Dawn
events.description: The celebration continues on the beach until dawn. The bonfires keep burning while groups scattered along the coast sing, dance and celebrate under the stars. Midnight swims for the boldest. The final farewell to the Patron Saint happens at first light with a collective swim in the Adriatic Sea.

opening.title: 72 hours that will change your summer
opening.description: A unique event, a unique experience. An opportunity to experience the tradition of San Basso, to experience the dream of Termoli. A moment of pure emotion and pure colors.
